info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 08 at 8:32AM CDT until June 08 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 AM CDT FOR GRADY...SOUTHEASTERN CADDO AND SOUTHERN CANADIAN COUNTIES... At 832 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Union City to 5 miles northeast of Verden to 4 miles southeast of Anadarko, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Oklahoma City, Chickasha, Blanchard, Anadarko, Mustang, Tuttle, Union City, Minco, Binger, Fort Cobb, Alex, Verden, Cement, Amber, Bridge Creek, Gracemont, Pocasset, Norge, Bradley and Tabler. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
